page.title: 17THE LEGEND OF ST ARILDA
page.content: {Pages 17 & 18 compiled by Fleur Leslie {Henrietta Wakeford, & Erica Smallbone The area around{Kington}has long associations with{St Arilda.}Legend says she was a Christian girl killed by a Roman soldier for refusing to make love with him. She is buried in the crypt of{Gloucester Cathedral.}The stones of ST Arilda's well are said to be stained red by her blood. In fact it is due to mineral deposits. Another theory is she was a Celtic goddess of the spring, found on{St {Arild's farm.}The water from this spring is very cold and clear. Nearby is{St Arild's House,}built in Queen Anne's reign,with no passages.It is said to have a friendly ghost. There is an{old cider press}at this house, left over from when people used to bring their apples to be crushed. {Cider}is still made in this area.
